content.text: Traits are optional character modifiers taken at creation. They provide a significant benefit with a significant ongoing cost. Most characters have zero or one trait.

content.label: Genius
content.text: Your mind works faster than everyone else's. The cost is that it never stops working.
items: Cost: Lose 1 starting T1 skill pick (start with 2 + résumé instead of 3 + résumé)
Trade-off: Stress system hits harder — gain stress from ally injuries, critical failures, and unsolvable problems. Breakdowns happen. See Downtime Learning doc.

content.label: Scarred Veteran
content.text: You've been in the field. You've got the scars and the gear to prove it — and less runway before the next one kills you.
items: Benefit: +200 starting credits and 1 free augment (any T1 from any tree — you've been in the field)
Cost: Start with 2 Scars already (and their debuffs: Battle-Worn + Lingering Ache)
Trade-off: You start closer to death. Death DC is already at 2 (95% survival on next scar). But you're experienced and equipped.

content.label: Rift-Touched
content.text: You've been exposed to raw rift energy. You're already changed — the mutation is yours, bonus AND built-in complication.
items: Benefit: One free Standard-tier mutation with no installation cost
Cost: Start with 5 Toxicity and the mutation is involuntary (GM rolls or assigns). Can't be removed.
Trade-off: You've been exposed. You're already changed. The mutation is yours — bonus AND built-in complication. Can't be removed.

content.label: Corporate Asset
content.text: You're comfortable. But you're owned. The corp can ping you with jobs you can't refuse without consequences.
items: Benefit: Start with +300 credits and corporate housing (0 cr/day living costs)
Cost: Corp tracks your location, monitors your augments, and can issue mandatory assignments
Trade-off: Your data is in their system. Privacy doesn't exist. The corp can ping you with jobs you can't refuse without consequences.

content.label: Ghost
content.text: No records exist. No contractor ID. Corps don't know you exist. Total freedom from surveillance — total exclusion from services.
items: Benefit: No records exist. No contractor ID. Corps don't know you exist. Total freedom from surveillance.
Cost: -200 starting credits. Cannot take corporate contracts (freelance/black market only until you establish ID).
Trade-off: Corp contracts pay better, corp clinics won't treat you, and corp stores won't sell to you without ID. The street is your home.
